19  std::cout << ("camera drain node base destructed\n");

23  void Drain_base::initialize() {
24  create_directories();
25  define_subscribers();
26 
27  ros::NodeHandle& handle = getMyNodeHandle();
28 
29  timer = handle.createTimer(ros::Duration(5), &Drain_base::timerCallback, this);
30  }

33  Drain_base& Drain_base::create_directories() {
34 
35  ros::NodeHandle& private_handle = getMyPrivateNodeHandle();
36 
37  if (!private_handle.getParam("base_path", base_path)) {
38  std::cout << "No parameter for image base path specified, will use default: " << base_path << "\n";
39  } else {
40  std::cout << "Image base path: " << base_path << "\n";
41  }
42 
43  //get the year_month_day_hour_min of this moment
44  std::time_t t = std::time(nullptr);
45  std::tm* local_time = std::localtime(&t);
46 
47  std::stringstream ss;
48  ss << "/" << 1900 + (local_time->tm_year) << "_" << 1 + (local_time->tm_mon) << "_" << local_time->tm_mday
49  << "_" << local_time->tm_hour << "_" << local_time->tm_min;
50 
51  //create directory
52  boost::filesystem::path P{base_path};
53  P += ss.str();
54  boost::filesystem::create_directories(P);
55 
56  //set this as "current" directory
57  boost::filesystem::current_path(P);
58 
59  boost::filesystem::create_directories(std::string("rgb_images"));
60  boost::filesystem::create_directories(std::string("depth_images"));
61 
62  folder_path = P.string();
63  std::cout << "Folder path is set to " << folder_path << "\n";
64 
65  return *this;
66  }
67 
68 
69  Drain_base& Drain_base::define_subscribers() {
70  ros::NodeHandle& handle = getMyNodeHandle();
71  ros::NodeHandle& private_handle = getMyPrivateNodeHandle();
72 
73  if (!private_handle.getParam("diversity", diversity)) {
74  std::cout << "No parameter for drain channel diversity specified, will use default value: " << diversity
75  << "\n";
76  } else {
77  std::cout << "Number of drain channel diversity: " << diversity << "\n";
78  }
79 
80  depth_sub = new ros::Subscriber[diversity];
81  rgb_sub = new ros::Subscriber[diversity];
82 
83  //define subscribers
84  const std::string s_d("depth");
85  const std::string s_rgb("RGB");
86  for (int i = 0; i < diversity; i++) {
87  depth_sub[i] = handle.subscribe<sensor_msgs::Image>
88  (s_d + std::to_string(i), 1,
89  boost::bind(&Drain_base::drain_depth_callback, this, _1, i));
90  rgb_sub[i] = handle.subscribe<sensor_msgs::Image>
91  (s_rgb + std::to_string(i), 1,
92  boost::bind(&Drain_base::drain_rgb_callback, this, _1, i));
93  }
94 
95  std::cout << "Defined " << diversity << " subscribers\n";
96 
97  return *this;
98  }
99 
100 
101  void Drain_base::timerCallback(const ros::TimerEvent& event) {
102  std::cout << "Drain: Depth received " << depth_counter.getCurrentSeq()
103  << " frames, total transmission loss estimate is "
104  << depth_counter.getLoss() << " frames\n";
105  std::cout << "Drain: RGB received " << rgb_counter.getCurrentSeq()
106  << " frames, total transmission loss estimate is "
107  << rgb_counter.getLoss() << " frames\n";
108  }

110 
111  //todo: is it necessary to distinguish callback functions by passing in distinctive index numbers?
112  //callback to handle depth frame messages
113  void Drain_base::drain_depth_callback(const sensor_msgs::Image::ConstPtr& msg, int channel_num) {
114 
115  //By calling toCvShare we are obtaining a read-only reference to the OpenCV Mat data in the received message.
116  //If in the future, this Mat need to be *mutated*, we have to use toCvCopy instead of toCvShare.
117  cv_bridge::CvImageConstPtr cv_const_ptr = cv_bridge::toCvShare(msg);
118 
119  boost::async(
120  boost::bind(&Drain_base::save_image,
121  this,
122  cv_const_ptr,
123  boost::ref(msg->header),
124  DEPTH)
125  );
126 
127  depth_counter.updateSeq(std::stoul(msg->header.frame_id));
128  }
129 
130 
131  //callback to handle rgb frame messages
132  void Drain_base::drain_rgb_callback(const sensor_msgs::Image::ConstPtr& msg, int channel_num) {
133 
134  cv_bridge::CvImageConstPtr cv_const_ptr = cv_bridge::toCvShare(msg, "bgr8");
135 
136  boost::async(
137  boost::bind(&Drain_base::save_image,
138  this,
139  cv_const_ptr,
140  boost::ref(msg->header),
141  RGB)
142  );
143 
144  rgb_counter.updateSeq(std::stoul(msg->header.frame_id));
145  }
146 
147 
148  Drain_base&
149  Drain_base::save_image(cv_bridge::CvImageConstPtr cv_const_ptr, std_msgs::Header header, unsigned int channel) {
150 
151  //name the image with the timestamp obtained from the source
152  unsigned int seconds = header.stamp.sec;
153  unsigned int nanoseconds = header.stamp.nsec;
154  std::stringstream ss;
155  ss << std::setw(10) << std::setfill('0') << seconds << "." << std::setw(9) << std::setfill('0') << nanoseconds;
156 
157  std::string myStr;
158 
159  switch (channel) {
160  case RGB:
161  myStr = this->folder_path + std::string("/rgb_images/") + ss.str() + ".jpg";
162  break;
163 
164  case DEPTH:
165  myStr = this->folder_path + std::string("/depth_images/") + ss.str() + ".png";
166  break;
167 
168  default:
169  std::cout << "save_image: channel type is neither depth nor rgb, re-check your code!\n";
170  break;
171  }
172 
173  try {
174  cv::imwrite(myStr, cv_const_ptr->image);
175  }
176  catch (cv_bridge::Exception& e) {
177  std::cout << "cv_bridge exception: " << e.what() << "\n";
178  return *this;
179  }
180  return *this;
181  }
182
